financial_covenant_candidates.raw_snippet: 7.15 Financial Covenants The Maximum Total Leverage Ratio is set with a series of measurement periods and targets. The following table illustrates the targets: | Measurement Period ending | Total Leverage Ratio | May 3, 2024 | 5.50:1.00 | August 2, 2024 | 5.50:1.00 | November 1, 2024 | 6.00:1.00 | January 31, 2025 | 5.25:1.00 | May 2, 2025 | 5.25:1.00 | ... | February 2, 2029 | 4.25:1.00 |
7.1 Minimum Liquidity Permits Liquidity, as of the last Business Day of each Fiscal Month, to be less than $50,000,000.

facility_summaries.maturity_text: five years after the Closing Date

candidates.raw_snippet: Pricing level | Total Leverage Ratio | Base Rate Loans | SOFR Loans | --- | --- | --- | --- | I | ≥ 2.75 to 1.00 | 7.25% | 8.25% | II | < 2.75 to 1.00 and ≥ 2.25 to 1.00 | 7.00% | 8.00% | III | < 2.25 to 1.00 | 6.75% | 7.75% |

"Base Rate" means for any day a floating rate equal to the greater of (i) the Prime Rate in effect on such date (or ...), (ii) the Federal Funds Rate in effect on such day, plus 1/2 of 1%, and (iii) Term SOFR for a one-month tenor in effect on such day (or if such day is not a Business Day, the immediately preceding Business Day) (taking into account the Floor) plus 1% per annum; provided, further, that if at any time Term SOFR is not available, Base Rate shall be calculated without reference to clause (c) above.
